question_text: A company wants to roll out fingerprint authentication across its fleet of laptops. What two requirements must be met for successful deployment?
answer_options: All systems must include biometric-compatible hardware
Each user must have a unique fingerprint scanner
Group Policy must allow biometric sign-in
Each user must install third-party fingerprint software
correct_answer: All systems must include biometric-compatible hardware
Group Policy must allow biometric sign-in
explanation: Biometric login requires supported hardware and appropriate OS-level permissions. BitLocker and third-party software are unrelated to core functionality.
